Description: Microcontrollers used in automation, process control systems, industrial equipment, and robust sensor networks. Ex: motor controllers, PLCs, industrial sensors.
Designed for portable or stationary medical devices requiring high precision and low power consumption. Ex: pulse oximeters, ECG monitors, insulin pumps.
MCUs built for reliability in harsh conditions, suitable for vehicle systems and real-time safety-critical tasks. Ex: ABS controllers, airbags, ECUs, infotainment systems.
Optimized for connectivity, power efficiency, and compact size, ideal for smart and interconnected devices. Ex: smart home sensors, Wi-Fi/BLE modules, IoT nodes.
Used in everyday electronic devices where low cost, compactness, and fast integration are key. Ex: appliances, remote controls, digital watches, toys.
Ultra-low power microcontrollers tailored for compact, battery-powered devices worn on the body. Ex: fitness trackers, smartwatches, health monitors.
